verses.verse: Dead <S%H4194><s%> flies <S%H2070><s%> cause the ointment <S%H8081><s%> of the apothecary <S%H7543><s%> to send <S%H5042><s%> forth a stinking <S%H887><s%> smell: <S%H7381><s%> so does a little <S%H4592><s%> folly <S%H5531><s%> him that is in reputation <S%H3368><s%> for wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and honor. <S%H3519><s%>
A wise <S%H2450><s%> man's heart <S%H3820><s%> is at his right <S%H3225><s%> hand; <S%H3225><s%> but a fool's <S%H3684><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> at his left. <S%H8040><s%>

Yes <S%H1571><s%> also, <S%H1571><s%> when he that is a fool <S%H5530><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> by the way, <S%H1870><s%> his wisdom <S%H3820><s%> fails <S%H2638><s%> him, and he said <S%H559><s%> to every <S%H3605><s%> one that he is a fool. <S%H5530><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the ruler <S%H4910><s%> rise <S%H5927><s%> up against <S%H5921><s%> you, leave <S%H5117><s%> not your place; <S%H4725><s%> for yielding <S%H4832><s%> pacifies <S%H3240><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> offenses. <S%H2399><s%>
There is an evil <S%H7451><s%> which I have seen <S%H7200><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun, <S%H8121><s%> as an error <S%H7684><s%> which proceeds <S%H3318><s%> from the ruler: <S%H7989><s%>
Folly <S%H5529><s%> is set <S%H5414><s%> in great <S%H7227><s%> dignity, <S%H4791><s%> and the rich <S%H6223><s%> sit <S%H3427><s%> in low <S%H8216><s%> place.
I have seen <S%H7200><s%> servants <S%H5650><s%> on horses, <S%H5483><s%> and princes <S%H8269><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> as servants <S%H5650><s%> on the earth. <S%H776><s%>
He that digs <S%H2658><s%> a pit <S%H1475><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> into it; and whoever breaks <S%H6555><s%> an hedge, <S%H1447><s%> a serpent <S%H5175><s%> shall bite <S%H5391><s%> him.
Whoever removes <S%H5265><s%> stones <S%H68><s%> shall be hurt <S%H6087><s%> therewith; and he that splits <S%H1234><s%> wood <S%H6086><s%> shall be endangered <S%H5533><s%> thereby.

If <S%H518><s%> the iron <S%H1270><s%> be blunt, <S%H6949><s%> and he do not whet <S%H7043><s%> the edge, <S%H6440><s%> then must he put <S%H1396><s%> to more strength: <S%H2428><s%> but wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is profitable <S%H3504><s%> to direct. <S%H3787><s%>

Surely <S%H518><s%> the serpent <S%H5175><s%> will bite <S%H5391><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> enchantment; <S%H3908><s%> and a babbler <S%H1167><s%> <S%H3956><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> better. <S%H3504><s%>
The words <S%H1697><s%> of a wise <S%H2450><s%> man's mouth <S%H6310><s%> are gracious; <S%H2580><s%> but the lips <S%H8193><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> will swallow <S%H1104><s%> up himself.

The beginning <S%H8462><s%> of the words <S%H1697><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> is foolishness: <S%H5531><s%> and the end <S%H319><s%> of his talk <S%H6310><s%> is mischievous <S%H7451><s%> madness. <S%H1948><s%>

A fool <S%H5530><s%> also is full <S%H7235><s%> of words: <S%H1697><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> cannot <S%H3045><s%> tell <S%H5046><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> shall be; and what <S%H4100><s%> shall be after <S%H310><s%> him, who <S%H4310><s%> can tell <S%H5046><s%> him?

The labor <S%H5999><s%> of the foolish <S%H3684><s%> wearies <S%H3021><s%> every one of them, because <S%H834><s%> he knows <S%H3045><s%> not how <S%H834><s%> to go <S%H3212><s%> to the city. <S%H5892><s%>
Woe <S%H337><s%> to you, O land, <S%H776><s%> when your king <S%H4428><s%> is a child, <S%H5288><s%> and your princes <S%H8269><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> in the morning! <S%H1242><s%>

Blessed <S%H835><s%> are you, O land, <S%H776><s%> when your king <S%H4428><s%> is the son <S%H1121><s%> of nobles, <S%H2715><s%> and your princes <S%H8269><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> in due season, <S%H6256><s%> for strength, <S%H1369><s%> and not for drunkenness! <S%H8358><s%>

By much slothfulness <S%H6103><s%> the building <S%H4746><s%> decays; <S%H4355><s%> and through idleness <S%H8220><s%> of the hands <S%H3027><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> drops <S%H1811><s%> through. <S%H1811><s%>
A feast <S%H3899><s%> is made <S%H6213><s%> for laughter, <S%H7814><s%> and wine <S%H3196><s%> makes merry: <S%H8055><s%> but money <S%H3701><s%> answers <S%H6030><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> things.

Curse <S%H7043><s%> not the king, <S%H4428><s%> no <S%H408><s%> not in your thought; <S%H4093><s%> and curse <S%H7043><s%> not the rich <S%H6223><s%> in your bedchamber: <S%H2315><s%> <S%H4296><s%> for a bird <S%H5775><s%> of the air <S%H8064><s%> shall carry <S%H3212><s%> the voice, <S%H6963><s%> and that which has <S%H1167><s%> wings <S%H3671><s%> shall tell <S%H5046><s%> the matter. <S%H1697><s%>
